trans-unit.source: Configure and register your device
trans-unit.target: Configure and register your device

trans-unit.source: Explains how to use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to configure and register a StorSimple device that is running Update 1.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to configure and register a StorSimple device that is running Update 1.

trans-unit.source: Access the Windows PowerShell interface on your StorSimple device serial console.
trans-unit.target: Access the Windows PowerShell interface on your StorSimple device serial console.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console</linkText><title></title> for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console</linkText><title></title> for instructions.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow the procedure exactly or you will not be able to access the console.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow the procedure exactly or you will not be able to access the console.

trans-unit.source: In the session that opens up, press Enter one time to get a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: In the session that opens up, press Enter one time to get a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to choose the language that you would like to set for your device.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to choose the language that you would like to set for your device.

trans-unit.source: Specify the language, and then press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Specify the language, and then press Enter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>StorSimple configure and register device 1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>StorSimple configure and register device 1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the serial console menu that is presented, choose option 1 to log on with full access.
trans-unit.target: In the serial console menu that is presented, choose option 1 to log on with full access.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>StorSimple register device 2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>StorSimple register device 2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to configure the minimum required network settings for your device.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to configure the minimum required network settings for your device.

trans-unit.source: These configuration steps need to be performed on the active controller of the device.
trans-unit.target: These configuration steps need to be performed on the active controller of the device.

trans-unit.source: The serial console menu indicates the controller state in the banner message.
trans-unit.target: The serial console menu indicates the controller state in the banner message.

trans-unit.source: If you are not connect to the active controller, disconnect and then connect to the active controller.
trans-unit.target: If you are not connect to the active controller, disconnect and then connect to the active controller.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, type your password.
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, type your password.

trans-unit.source: The default device password is Password1.
trans-unit.target: The default device password is Password1.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command:

trans-unit.source: Invoke-HcsSetupWizard
trans-unit.target: Invoke-HcsSetupWizard

trans-unit.source: A setup wizard will appear to help you configure the network settings for the device.
trans-unit.target: A setup wizard will appear to help you configure the network settings for the device.

trans-unit.source: Supply the following information:
trans-unit.target: Supply the following information:

trans-unit.source: IP address for DATA 0 network interface
trans-unit.target: IP address for DATA 0 network interface

trans-unit.source: Subnet mask
trans-unit.target: Subnet mask

trans-unit.source: Gateway
trans-unit.target: Gateway

trans-unit.source: IP address for Primary DNS server
trans-unit.target: IP address for Primary DNS server

trans-unit.source: IP address for Primary NTP server
trans-unit.target: IP address for Primary NTP server

trans-unit.source: You may have to wait for a few minutes for the subnet mask and DNS settings to be applied.
trans-unit.target: You may have to wait for a few minutes for the subnet mask and DNS settings to be applied.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, configure your web proxy server.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, configure your web proxy server.

trans-unit.source: Although web proxy configuration is optional, be aware that if you use a web proxy, you can only configure it here.
trans-unit.target: Although web proxy configuration is optional, be aware that if you use a web proxy, you can only configure it here.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to <linkText>Configure web proxy for your device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Press Ctrl + C to exit the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: Press Ctrl + C to exit the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: Install the updates as follows:
trans-unit.target: Install the updates as follows:

trans-unit.source: Use the following cmdlet to set IPs on both the controllers:
trans-unit.target: Use the following cmdlet to set IPs on both the controllers:

trans-unit.source: Set-HcsNetInterface -InterfaceAlias Data0 -Controller0IPv4Address -Controller1IPv4Address
trans-unit.target: Set-HcsNetInterface -InterfaceAlias Data0 -Controller0IPv4Address -Controller1IPv4Address

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, run Get-HcsUpdateAvailability.
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, run Get-HcsUpdateAvailability.

trans-unit.source: You should be notified that updates are available.
trans-unit.target: You should be notified that updates are available.

trans-unit.source: Run Start-HcsUpdate.
trans-unit.target: Run Start-HcsUpdate.

trans-unit.source: You can run this command on any node.
trans-unit.target: You can run this command on any node.

trans-unit.source: Updates will be applied on the first controller, the controller will fail over, and then the updates will be applied on the other controller.
trans-unit.target: Updates will be applied on the first controller, the controller will fail over, and then the updates will be applied on the other controller.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the progress of the update by running Get-HcsUpdateStatus.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the progress of the update by running Get-HcsUpdateStatus.

trans-unit.source: The following sample output shows the update in progress.
trans-unit.target: The following sample output shows the update in progress.

trans-unit.source: After all the updates are successfully installed, run the following cmdlet to confirm that the software updates were applied correctly:
trans-unit.target: After all the updates are successfully installed, run the following cmdlet to confirm that the software updates were applied correctly:

trans-unit.source: Get-HcsSystem
trans-unit.target: Get-HcsSystem

trans-unit.source: You should see the following versions:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following versions:

trans-unit.source: HcsSoftwareVersion: 6.3.9600.17491
trans-unit.target: HcsSoftwareVersion: 6.3.9600.17491

trans-unit.source: CisAgentVersion: 1.0.9037.0
trans-unit.target: CisAgentVersion: 1.0.9037.0

trans-unit.source: MdsAgentVersion: 26.0.4696.1433
trans-unit.target: MdsAgentVersion: 26.0.4696.1433

trans-unit.source: Run the following cmdlet to confirm that the firmware update was applied correctly:
trans-unit.target: Run the following cmdlet to confirm that the firmware update was applied correctly:

trans-unit.source: Start-HcsFirmwareCheck.
trans-unit.target: Start-HcsFirmwareCheck.

trans-unit.source: The firmware status should be UpToDate.
trans-unit.target: The firmware status should be UpToDate.

trans-unit.source: Run the following cmdlet to point the device to the Microsoft Azure Government portal (because it points to the public Azure Management Portal by default).
trans-unit.target: Run the following cmdlet to point the device to the Microsoft Azure Government portal (because it points to the public Azure Management Portal by default).

trans-unit.source: This will restart both controllers.
trans-unit.target: This will restart both controllers.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use two PuTTY sessions to simultaneously connect to both controllers so that you can see when each controller is restarted.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use two PuTTY sessions to simultaneously connect to both controllers so that you can see when each controller is restarted.

trans-unit.source: Set-CloudPlatform -AzureGovt_US
trans-unit.target: Set-CloudPlatform -AzureGovt_US

trans-unit.source: You will see a confirmation message.
trans-unit.target: You will see a confirmation message.

trans-unit.source: Accept the default (Y).
trans-unit.target: Accept the default (Y).

trans-unit.source: Run the following cmdlet to resume setup:
trans-unit.target: Run the following cmdlet to resume setup:

trans-unit.source: Invoke-HcsSetupWizard
trans-unit.target: Invoke-HcsSetupWizard

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Resume setup wizard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Resume setup wizard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you resume setup, the wizard will be the Update 1 version (which corresponds to version 17469).
trans-unit.target: When you resume setup, the wizard will be the Update 1 version (which corresponds to version 17469).

trans-unit.source: Accept the network settings.
trans-unit.target: Accept the network settings.

trans-unit.source: You will see a validation message after you accept each setting.
trans-unit.target: You will see a validation message after you accept each setting.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, the device administrator password expires after the first session, and you will need to change it now.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, the device administrator password expires after the first session, and you will need to change it now.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, provide a device administrator password.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, provide a device administrator password.

trans-unit.source: A valid device administrator password must be between 8 and 15 characters.
trans-unit.target: A valid device administrator password must be between 8 and 15 characters.

trans-unit.source: The password must contain three of the following: lowercase, uppercase, numeric, and special characters.
trans-unit.target: The password must contain three of the following: lowercase, uppercase, numeric, and special characters.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple register device 5
trans-unit.target: StorSimple register device 5

trans-unit.source: The final step in the setup wizard registers your device with the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: The final step in the setup wizard registers your device with the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: For this, you will need the service registration key that you obtained in <linkText>Step 2: Get the service registration key</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For this, you will need the service registration key that you obtained in <linkText>Step 2: Get the service registration key</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After you supply the registration key, you may need to wait for 2-3 minutes before the device is registered.
trans-unit.target: After you supply the registration key, you may need to wait for 2-3 minutes before the device is registered.

trans-unit.source: You can press Ctrl + C at any time to exit the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: You can press Ctrl + C at any time to exit the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: If you have entered all the network settings (IP address for Data 0, Subnet mask, and Gateway), your entries will be retained.
trans-unit.target: If you have entered all the network settings (IP address for Data 0, Subnet mask, and Gateway), your entries will be retained.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>StorSimple registration progress</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>StorSimple registration progress</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the device is registered, a Service Data Encryption key will appear.
trans-unit.target: After the device is registered, a Service Data Encryption key will appear.

trans-unit.source: Copy this key and save it in a safe location.
trans-unit.target: Copy this key and save it in a safe location.

trans-unit.source: This key will be required with the service registration key to register additional devices with the StorSimple Manager service. Refer to StorSimple security for more information about this key.
trans-unit.target: This key will be required with the service registration key to register additional devices with the StorSimple Manager service. Refer to StorSimple security for more information about this key.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>StorSimple register device 7</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>StorSimple register device 7</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To copy the text from the serial console window, simply select the text.
trans-unit.target: To copy the text from the serial console window, simply select the text.

trans-unit.source: You should then be able to paste it in the clipboard or any text editor.
trans-unit.target: You should then be able to paste it in the clipboard or any text editor.

trans-unit.source: DO NOT use Ctrl + C to copy the service data encryption key.
trans-unit.target: DO NOT use Ctrl + C to copy the service data encryption key.

trans-unit.source: Using Ctrl + C will cause you to exit the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: Using Ctrl + C will cause you to exit the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the device administrator password will not be changed and the device will revert to the default password.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the device administrator password will not be changed and the device will revert to the default password.

trans-unit.source: Exit the serial console.
trans-unit.target: Exit the serial console.

trans-unit.source: Return to the Government Portal, and complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Return to the Government Portal, and complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Double-click your StorSimple Manager service to access the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: Double-click your StorSimple Manager service to access the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Click View connected devices.
trans-unit.target: Click View connected devices.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, verify that the device has successfully connected to the service by looking up the status.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, verify that the device has successfully connected to the service by looking up the status.

trans-unit.source: The device status should be Online.
trans-unit.target: The device status should be Online.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>StorSimple Devices page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>StorSimple Devices page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If the device status is Offline, wait for a couple of minutes for the device to come online.
trans-unit.target: If the device status is Offline, wait for a couple of minutes for the device to come online.

trans-unit.source: If the device is still offline after a few minutes, then you need to make sure that your firewall network was configured as described in the <linkText>network requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If the device is still offline after a few minutes, then you need to make sure that your firewall network was configured as described in the <linkText>network requirements for your StorSimple device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have HTTP 1.1 support, check port 9354 to make sure that it is open for outbound communication.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have HTTP 1.1 support, check port 9354 to make sure that it is open for outbound communication.

trans-unit.source: This port is used for communication between the StorSimple Manager service and your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This port is used for communication between the StorSimple Manager service and your StorSimple device.
